title: 105_hr185
content: The Act is titled the "Presidential Commission to Study Employment and Economic Insecurity in the American Workforce Act." It establishes a commission called the Presidential Commission to Study Employment and Economic Insecurity in the American Workforce, tasked with studying employment and economic insecurity in the American workforce. The Commission will examine economic and psychological insecurity in the US workforce caused by employment dislocation, stress, and lack of well-paid jobs. It will also recommend solutions to alleviate these issues through legislation and administrative action. The Commission, composed of 17 members appointed by various leaders, must be experts in labor and employment. Political affiliation is not a factor in appointments. The Commission, consisting of 17 members appointed based on expertise in labor and employment, must have all original members appointed within 3 months of the Act's enactment. Each member serves for the life of the Commission, without receiving pay. Travel expenses are provided, and 9 members form a quorum. The members elect a Chairperson who calls meetings as needed. SEC. 5. STAFF OF COMMISSION. The Chairperson appoints Commission personnel, subject to certain laws, and may request personnel from Federal agencies. SEC. 6. POWERS OF COMMISSION. The Commission has the authority to hold hearings, take testimony, receive evidence, administer oaths, delegate powers to members or agencies, obtain official data from US departments or agencies, and use the US mails. The Commission, as an agency of the United States, has the authority to issue subpoenas for witnesses and evidence related to its duties. The Administrator of General Services can provide administrative support services to the Commission upon request. The Commission also has immunity for witnesses under part V of title 18, United States Code. The Commission can seek court orders to enforce subpoenas issued during hearings. It also has the authority to contract with government or private agencies for supplies or services. The Commission must submit a detailed report to the President and Congress within 1 year of all members being appointed. It will terminate 30 days after submitting the report. Any spending authority authorized by the Act is subject to appropriations Acts.
